law.catch_line: Application Of Credit Cardholder’S Funds Held By Issuer; Authorization; Agreement Statement
law.text: A person issuing a credit card shall not apply any funds of the cardholder held for any purpose by the issuer of the card in order to satisfy a debt arising from the use of such credit card unless such action was previously authorized by the cardholder in a separately signed agreement whereby the cardholder agrees to pay debts incurred in his open-end-credit account by permitting the card issuer to deduct periodically all or a portion of such debt from the cardholder’s deposit account; provided, however, that such action shall not be taken with respect to a disputed item if the cardholder so requests. This agreement shall contain the following statement appearing conspicuously on the face thereof: YOU DO NOT HAVE TO SIGN THISAGREEMENT IN ORDER TOOBTAIN A CREDIT CARD.
